DataElement.preferredName: Brain Imaging Three-Dimensional Magnetization-Prepared Rapid Gradient Echo Imaging Imaging Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:A 3-dimensional imaging technique that combines the power of magnetization-prepared imaging and rapid 3-D gradient echo acquisition techniques to provide excellent tissue contrasts, high spatial resolution, and full tissue coverage in a short scan time. This technique is applicable for 3D imaging throughout the body._The result of imaging.

This technique is applicable for 3D imaging throughout the body.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

Property.preferredName: Three-Dimensional Magnetization-Prepared Rapid Gradient Echo Imaging
Property.preferredDefinition: A 3-dimensional imaging technique that combines the power of magnetization-prepared imaging and rapid 3-D gradient echo acquisition techniques to provide excellent tissue contrasts, high spatial resolution, and full tissue coverage in a short scan time. This technique is applicable for 3D imaging throughout the body.

Concepts.longName: Three-Dimensional Magnetization-Prepared Rapid Gradient Echo Imaging
Concepts.definition: A 3-dimensional imaging technique that combines the power of magnetization-prepared imaging and rapid 3-D gradient echo acquisition techniques to provide excellent tissue contrasts, high spatial resolution, and full tissue coverage in a short scan time. This technique is applicable for 3D imaging throughout the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formation of a blood clot (thrombus) in the lumen of a vein.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Three-Dimensional (3D) Magnet
ReferenceDocuments.description: Three-Dimensional (3D) Magnetization-Prepared RApid Gradient Echo (MP-RAGE), An image that captures the high tissue contrast in the brain and provides high spatial resolution of the whole brain in a short scan time.
